etymology.description: Pictogram: a hand holding a rod or brush; similar to 事 and 支.
etymology.interpretation: Depicts a hand grasping a staff or writing brush, linking the image to authority, administration, and control. This association led to meanings like overseer or to govern, and it later became established as a surname.

examples.chinese: 尹先生今天来访(尹先生今天來訪)。
examples.english: Mr. Yin paid a visit today.

examples.chinese: 新任县尹上任后(新任縣尹上任後)，整顿吏治(整頓吏治)。
examples.pinyin: Xīnrèn xiànyǐn shàngrèn hòu, zhěngdùn lìzhì.
examples.english: After the newly appointed county magistrate took office, he reformed the administration.

examples.chinese: 我班上有个同学姓尹(我班上有個同學姓尹)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ bān shàng yǒu gè tóngxué xìng Yǐn.
examples.english: There is a classmate in my class whose surname is Yin.
